Class TopicHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.upenn.cis.precise.openicelite.middleware.mqtt.type.TopicHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITopicHandler

    public class TopicHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ITopicHandler
    Shared class to ensure standardized and centralized place for MQTT topic
    Author:
    Hung Nguyen (hungng@seas.upenn.edu)

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getClientBaseTopic(java.lang.String projectName)
      Return root topic for all clients (should be used by MapManager to subscribe to all client topics)
      java.lang.String getClientTopic(java.lang.String projectName, java.lang.String clientName)
      Return topic for corresponding client
      java.lang.String getDataBaseTopic(java.lang.String projectName)
      Return root topic for all data
      java.lang.String getDataTopic(java.lang.String projectName, java.lang.String dongleId, java.lang.String deviceId)
      Return data topic based on project name, dongle ID, and device ID
      java.lang.String getDeviceId(java.lang.String topic)
      Return device ID from published topic
      java.lang.String getDongleId(java.lang.String topic)
      Return dongle ID from published topic
      java.lang.String getOnlineTopic(java.lang.String projectName)
      Return "Online" topic managed by MapManager based on project name
      java.lang.String getProjectName(java.lang.String topic)
      Return project name from published topic
      java.lang.String getStatusBaseTopic(java.lang.String projectName)
      Return root topic for all statues (should be used by MapManager to subscribe to all status topics)
      java.lang.String getStatusTopic(java.lang.String projectName, java.lang.String dongleId)
      Return status topic based on project name, dongle ID
      java.lang.String[] getTopicInfo(java.lang.String topic)
      Return project name, dongle ID, device ID as a String array with the same order from published topic
      ITopicHandler.TopicType getTopicType(java.lang.String topic)
      Return topic type from published topic
